judge_resource.tool_description: A nonlinear dimensionality reduction method developed to explicitly leverage auxiliary (behavior) labels and/or time to discover latent features in time series data, specifically latent neural embeddings. It combines ideas from nonlinear independent component analysis with contrastive learning to generate embeddings conditioned on behavior and/or time.
related_papers: Learning identifiable and interpretable latent models of high-dimensional neural activity using pi-VAE
judge_resource.judge_rationale: The CEBRA resource entry is well-structured and conforms to BBQS standards. It contains all the required fields with appropriate information. The tool description clearly explains its purpose and methodology for neural embedding generation. The target and specific target information are correctly mapped to ontological concepts with proper IDs. Related resources (models, datasets, papers, tools) are comprehensive and relevant to the domain. The URL links to the official repository. The tool type and category are appropriate for a dimensionality reduction method in behavioral quantification. The only minor improvement could be more detailed specification of the related papers (adding DOIs or full citations) and potentially more structured information about the related datasets. Overall, this is a high-quality entry that provides valuable information about the CEBRA tool.
